titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Sol Babitz Papers PASC-M.0052
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by UCLA Library Special Collections staff, 2002.

p.date: Online finding aid last updated 2022 July 14.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-12-12 13:56:45 -0800.

did.abstract: This collection consists of research notes, musical sketches, manuscripts, published scores, books, pamphlets, periodical issues, offprints, typed drafts of articles, photocopies of articles, scores, miscellaneous printed music pages, and correspondence.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Reproduction and Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Sol Babitz Papers (Collection PASC-M 52). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Library Special Collections staff, 2002.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Administrative/Biographical History
bioghist.p: Babitz was born on Oct. 11, 1911, in Brooklyn, NY; he was largely a self-taught violinist since leaving high school; his violin teachers included Carl Flesch in Berlin and Marcel Chailley in Paris; his interest in performance practice was aroused by the writing of Arnold Dolmetsch and encouraged by Igor Stravinsky, whose string parts Babitz edited for many years; he was a violinist with the Los Angeles Philharmonic from 1933-37, and then played with Hollywood studio orchestras until 1952; editor, International musician (1941-62); co-founded the Early Music Laboratory (EML) in 1948; he devoted much of his research to the problems of performance practices in baroque and classical music through studying and interpreting 17th and 18th century treatises, and he incorporated his findings in recordings, articles, and bulletins; died in 1982.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Research notes, manuscript and typed; musical sketches and manuscripts; published scores, books, pamphlets, periodical issues and offprints, with and without annotations; typed drafts of articles; photocopies of articles, scores, and miscellaneous printed music pages; and correspondence - all mostly related to baroque performance practice research done through the Early Music Laboratory (EML). Includes a set of EML Bulletins, other EML publications, and disc recordings of EML sponsored performances.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes Babitz transcriptions of works by Bach, Chabrier, Corelli, Dohnany, Fantana, Geminiani, Greshwin, Handel, Henebry, Josquin, Marais, Marini, Metteis, Mozart, Purcell, Spinacino, Stravinksy, Tappert/Lully, Walther, and unknown composers. The Handel Sonata IV contains a note for Einstein.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This sub-series consists of sketch books, solos of Bessie Smith, Duke Ellington, Joe Venuti, Sidney Bechet, Louis Armstrong, Brunskwick, Morton, from Okeh label and others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Annotated published scores and methods books. Original manuscript scores with annotations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Loose annotated music.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains miscellaneous unidentified musical sketches and manuscripts. Xerox and photocopies of miscellaneous printed music pages. Ozalid copies of pages from miscellaneous works by unidentified composers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Loose leaf notebooks with pencil and ink entries, miscellaneous non-EML books and brochures, original manuscript scores, some with annotations.

did.unittitle: Early Music Laboratory Bulletins and Management

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series consists of notes, mock-ups, off-prints, audio materials, typed drafts, and completed articles for the Early Music Laboratory Bulletin, published by Babitz.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS UNPROCESSED AUDIO/AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Audio materials are not currently available for access and will require further processing and assessment. If you have questions about this material please email spec-coll@library.ucla.edu.

scopecontent.p: Set of EML bulletins, and other EML publications. Disc recordings of EML sponsored performances. Xerox copies of music editions of early music works. Articles by Babitz and Boyden.

scopecontent.p: Set of EML bulletins, and other EML publications. Disc recordings of EML sponsored performances. Xerox copies of music editions of early music works. Articles by Babitz and Boyden.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Set of EML bulletins, and other EML publications. Disc recordings of EML sponsored performances. Xerox copies of music editions of early music works. Additionally, in this box are 2 recordings of The Los Angeles Sax Quartet - The Art of the Fugue, and 3 recordings of The Future of Baroque Music, a lecture/demonstration by Sol Babitz.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS UNPROCESSED AUDIO MATERIALS: audio/audiovisual materials are not currently available for access and will require further processing and assessment. If you have questions about this material please email spec-coll@library.ucla.edu.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The series consists of annotated and blank original printed copies assorted sheet music. Included are works by composers such as Bach, Mestrino, anonymous Renaissance songs, Couperin L'Art de Toucher le Clavecin, Dolmetsch treatise, Mestrino, Kolem, Mozart, Selinsky, Warren, Purcell, Abdelazer, Dolmetsch, Dvorak, Stravinsky, and unknown composers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Professional sheetmusic, scores, and parts for other people's music.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Annotated published scores and methods books. Annotated xerox and ozalid copies of scores.

phystech.p: CONTAINS UNPROCESSED AUDIO MATERIALS: audio materials are not currently available for access and will require further processing and assessment. If you have questions about this material please email spec-coll@library.ucla.edu.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series consists of various books and journals used by Babtiz in his research of Baroque musical practices. Titles are largely in German.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous annotated books and periodical issues annotated by Babitz.

scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous annotated books and periodical issues annotated by Babitz.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS UNPROCESSED AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: audiovisual materials are not currently available for access and will require further processing and assessment. If you have questions about this material please email spec-coll@library.ucla.edu.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series consists of personal and professional correspondence relating to early music practice, the EML Bulletin, article submissions, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: General correspondence, research notes and papers.
